required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study in Older Subjects to Evaluate the Safety and Ability of Andexanet Alfa to Reverse the Anticoagulation Effect of Apixaban
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-controlled Study in Older Subjects to Assess Safety and the Reversal of Apixaban Anticoagulation With Intravenously Administered Andexanet Alfa

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this stuy is to evaluate the ability of Andexanet Alfa to reverse the anticoagulation effect of Apixaban.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at the Nadir (Parts I and II)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
primary_outcome.description: In Part I, the primary endpoint was percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity at the nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minutes or +5 minutes time point following the end of the bolus. In Part II, the primary endpoint was the percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity from its baseline to nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion. The baseline for the primary endpoint in both parts was the anti-fXa activity just prior to administration of andexanet, 3 hours following the Day 4 dose of apixaban. Anti-fXa activity was measured by a modified chromogenic assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at the Nadir (Part II)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part II)
secondary_outcome.description: The percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity at the nadir, following the bolus, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part II). Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Number of Participants With ≥80% Reduction in the Anti-fXa Activity From Baseline to Nadir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of ≥80% reduction in anti-fXa activity from its baseline to nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part I) or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy -Change From Baseline in Free Apixaban Concentration at the Nadir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in free apixaban concentration (ng/mL) at the nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for free apixaban at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part I) or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Free plasma concentrations of apixaban was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma with high-throughput equilibrium dialysis followed by liquid chromatography mass spectrometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Change in Thrombin Generation (ETP) From Baseline to Its Peak [Parts I and II]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +10 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in ETP from baseline to its peak, where peak was defined as the largest value for ETP between the +2 minute time point and the +10 minute time point after the end of the andexanet bolus (inclusive) {Part I] or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo. ETP was measured using a tissue factor-initiated thrombin generation assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Number of Participants With Thrombin Generation (ETP) Above the Lower Limit of the Derived Normal Range at Its Peak (mITT Population)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +10 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with ETP above the lower limit of the normal range at its peak, between the +2 minute time point and the +10 minute time point after the end of the andexanet bolus (inclusive) [Part I] or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. ETP was measured using a tissue factor-initiated thrombin generation assay

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Reasonably healthy men and women aged 50 to 75
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of abnormal bleeding, active bleeding or risk factors for bleeding
- History of thrombosis or risk factors for thrombosis
- History of adult asthma or use of inhaled medications

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subject recruitment occurred at investigative site in the US between March 2014 through December 2014
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Apixaban was administered orally at 5 mg twice daily for 3.5 days to steady-state and then administered andexanet as a bolus (400 mg; Part I) or as a bolus followed by an infusion (400 mg bolus followed by 4 mg/min infusion for 120 minutes, 880 mg total dose; Part II). Bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose.

group.title: Placebo (Part I)
group.description: Placebo was administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part I)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Placebo was administered IV as a bolus followed by a continuous infusion for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute, followed by a continuous infusion of 480 mg at 4 mg/minute for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

baseline.population: 33 and 32 subjects were randomized in Part I and Part II of study, respectively

group.title: Placebo (Part I)
group.description: Placebo was administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part I)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute (Part 1). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Placebo was administered IV as a bolus followed by a continuous infusion for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute, followed by a continuous infusion of 480 mg at 4 mg/minute for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at the Nadir (Parts I and II)
outcome.description: In Part I, the primary endpoint was percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity at the nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minutes or +5 minutes time point following the end of the bolus. In Part II, the primary endpoint was the percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity from its baseline to nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion. The baseline for the primary endpoint in both parts was the anti-fXa activity just prior to administration of andexanet, 3 hours following the Day 4 dose of apixaban. Anti-fXa activity was measured by a modified chromogenic assay.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-Treat Population included all subjects receiving andexanet/placebo with anti-fXa activity baseline value at ≥1 timepoints: 2 or 5 minute after the end of the bolus (Part I; N = 33); 110 minute during continuous infusion, 2 minute before or 5 minute after the end of continuous infusion (Part II; N = 31).

group.title: Placebo (Part I)
group.description: Placebo was administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part I)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute (Part 1). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Placebo was administered IV as a bolus followed by a continuous infusion for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute, followed by a continuous infusion of 480 mg at 4 mg/minute for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

measure.title: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at the Nadir (Parts I and II)
measure.description: In Part I, the primary endpoint was percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity at the nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minutes or +5 minutes time point following the end of the bolus. In Part II, the primary endpoint was the percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity from its baseline to nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion. The baseline for the primary endpoint in both parts was the anti-fXa activity just prior to administration of andexanet, 3 hours following the Day 4 dose of apixaban. Anti-fXa activity was measured by a modified chromogenic assay.
measure.population: Modified Intent-to-Treat Population included all subjects receiving andexanet/placebo with anti-fXa activity baseline value at ≥1 timepoints: 2 or 5 minute after the end of the bolus (Part I; N = 33); 110 minute during continuous infusion, 2 minute before or 5 minute after the end of continuous infusion (Part II; N = 31).

outcome.title: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at the Nadir (Part II)
outcome.description: The percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity at the nadir, following the bolus, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part II). Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part II)
outcome.population: mITT; 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the PD analysis in Part I and II, respectively.

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Placebo was administered IV as a bolus followed by a continuous infusion for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute, followed by a continuous infusion of 480 mg at 4 mg/minute for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

measure.title: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at the Nadir (Part II)
measure.description: The percent change from baseline in anti-fXa activity at the nadir, following the bolus, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part II). Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo
measure.population: mITT; 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the PD analysis in Part I and II, respectively.

outcome.title: Efficacy: Number of Participants With ≥80% Reduction in the Anti-fXa Activity From Baseline to Nadir
outcome.description: Occurrence of ≥80% reduction in anti-fXa activity from its baseline to nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part I) or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
outcome.population: mITT; 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the pharmacodynamics (PD) analysis in Part I and II, respectively.

group.title: Placebo (Part I)
group.description: Placebo was administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part I)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute (Part 1). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Placebo was administered IV as a bolus followed by a continuous infusion for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute, followed by a continuous infusion of 480 mg at 4 mg/minute for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

measure.title: Efficacy: Number of Participants With ≥80% Reduction in the Anti-fXa Activity From Baseline to Nadir
measure.description: Occurrence of ≥80% reduction in anti-fXa activity from its baseline to nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for anti-fXa activity at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part I) or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo
measure.population: mITT; 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the pharmacodynamics (PD) analysis in Part I and II, respectively.

outcome.title: Efficacy -Change From Baseline in Free Apixaban Concentration at the Nadir
outcome.description: Change from baseline in free apixaban concentration (ng/mL) at the nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for free apixaban at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part I) or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Free plasma concentrations of apixaban was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma with high-throughput equilibrium dialysis followed by liquid chromatography mass spectrometry.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +5 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
outcome.population: 54 subjects who received apixaban were included in the apixaban pharmacokinetics (PK) analysis

group.title: Placebo (Part I)
group.description: Placebo was administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part I)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute (Part 1). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Placebo was administered IV as a bolus followed by a continuous infusion for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute, followed by a continuous infusion of 480 mg at 4 mg/minute for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

measure.title: Efficacy -Change From Baseline in Free Apixaban Concentration at the Nadir
measure.description: Change from baseline in free apixaban concentration (ng/mL) at the nadir, when nadir was defined as the smaller value for free apixaban at the +2 minute or +5 minute time point after the completion of the andexanet bolus (Part I) or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Free plasma concentrations of apixaban was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma with high-throughput equilibrium dialysis followed by liquid chromatography mass spectrometry.
measure.population: 54 subjects who received apixaban were included in the apixaban pharmacokinetics (PK) analysis

outcome.title: Efficacy: Change in Thrombin Generation (ETP) From Baseline to Its Peak [Parts I and II]
outcome.description: Change in ETP from baseline to its peak, where peak was defined as the largest value for ETP between the +2 minute time point and the +10 minute time point after the end of the andexanet bolus (inclusive) {Part I] or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo. ETP was measured using a tissue factor-initiated thrombin generation assay.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +10 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
outcome.population: 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the PD analysis in Part I and II, respectively; mITT population

group.title: Placebo (Part I)
group.description: Placebo was administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part I)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute (Part 1). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Placebo was administered IV as a bolus followed by a continuous infusion for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: Andexanet was administered IV as a bolus of 400 mg at a target rate of approximately 30 mg/minute, followed by a continuous infusion of 480 mg at 4 mg/minute for 120 minutes (Part II). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

measure.title: Efficacy: Change in Thrombin Generation (ETP) From Baseline to Its Peak [Parts I and II]
measure.description: Change in ETP from baseline to its peak, where peak was defined as the largest value for ETP between the +2 minute time point and the +10 minute time point after the end of the andexanet bolus (inclusive) {Part I] or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. Baseline was the last assessment obtained prior to the first dose of andexanet or placebo. ETP was measured using a tissue factor-initiated thrombin generation assay.
measure.population: 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the PD analysis in Part I and II, respectively; mITT population

outcome.title: Efficacy: Number of Participants With Thrombin Generation (ETP) Above the Lower Limit of the Derived Normal Range at Its Peak (mITT Population)
outcome.description: Number of participants with ETP above the lower limit of the normal range at its peak, between the +2 minute time point and the +10 minute time point after the end of the andexanet bolus (inclusive) [Part I] or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. ETP was measured using a tissue factor-initiated thrombin generation assay
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to +2 minutes or +10 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo bolus (Part I), or 10 minutes prior to end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion or 5 minutes after the end of andexanet/placebo continuous infusion (Part II)
outcome.population: 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the PD analysis in Part I and II, respectively; mITT population

group.description: Placebo was administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus (Part I). The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban).

The bolus was started 3 hours after the last apixaban dose (at the approximate steady-state Cmax for apixaban)

measure.title: Efficacy: Number of Participants With Thrombin Generation (ETP) Above the Lower Limit of the Derived Normal Range at Its Peak (mITT Population)
measure.description: Number of participants with ETP above the lower limit of the normal range at its peak, between the +2 minute time point and the +10 minute time point after the end of the andexanet bolus (inclusive) [Part I] or between the 110-minute time point (10 minutes prior to the end of the continuous infusion) and the 5-minute time point after the end of the continuous infusion (inclusive) [Part II]. ETP was measured using a tissue factor-initiated thrombin generation assay
measure.population: 33 and 31 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the PD analysis in Part I and II, respectively; mITT population

reported_events.desc: The Safety Analysis Population consisted of all subjects randomized and treated with study drug (andexanet or placebo)

group.title: Placebo (Part I)
group.description: Vehicle Control

group.title: Andexanet (Part I)
group.description: 400 mg bolus

group.title: Placebo (Part II)
group.description: Vehicle Control

group.title: Andexanet (Part II)
group.description: 400 mg bolus + 480 mg infusion (4 mg/min)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Conducted in healthy volunteers at Clinical Research Organization.
